meanings.def: small pieces of rubbish such as paper, cans and bottles, that people have left lying in a public place
examples: There will be fines for people who drop litter.
Please do not leave litter after your picnic.
Pick up your litter and take it home with you.

meanings.def: a number of things that are lying in an untidy way
examples: The floor was covered with a litter of newspapers, clothes and empty cups.

meanings.def: a dry substance that is put in a shallow open box for pets, especially cats, to use as a toilet when they are indoors
examples: (also especially North American English) kitty litter

meanings.def: a number of baby animals that one mother gives birth to at the same time
examples: the runt (= the smallest and weakest baby) of the litter
‘Chief’ was born six years ago, one of a litter of 11.

meanings.def: the substance, especially straw, that is used for farm animals to sleep on
a kind of chair or bed that was used in the past for carrying important people
to be spread around a place, making it look untidy
examples: Piles of books and newspapers littered the floor.

meanings.def: to leave things in a place, making it look untidy
examples: be littered with something The floor was littered with papers.

meanings.def: to contain or involve a lot of a particular type of thing, usually something bad
examples: Your essay is littered with spelling mistakes.
